tafsirQuiz.question: According to the tafsir, what should we understand from this verse?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: This is because the nature of man’s creation is different. This freedom of action has given the opportunity to human beings to create disturbance and imbalance in the world
distractors: This verse addresses only legal rulings
This verse focuses on scientific facts
This verse is primarily about historical events

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Mulk, Ayah 5?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The fact is that if there were to be no reckoning of the evil people brought to account in the Hereafter, the entire meaningfulness of the universe would become inexplicable
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: It is this balance which has made the earth habitable for human beings. We should be grateful to God for the balanced world provided to us and seek His gracious help against any destructive conditions that may develop as a result of the world’s equilibrium being upset
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce
This verse promises paradise to the righteous

tafsirQuiz.question: Which concept is emphasized in Surah Al-Mulk, Ayah 15?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: But man is so forgetful that he indulges in arrogance in a world in which the natural phenomena visible all around him ought to teach him the lesson of obedience to God
distractors: This verse narrates a historical event
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Mulk, Ayah 22?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Quite another type of person is one who investigates whatever he hears, who tries to understand more accurately whatever he sees, and who discovers the Truth by coming out of his personal shell
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Even if there is the slightest sensitivity in a man, these last utterances are enough to make him feel the urge to reform himself. When the addressee is not convinced by reasoning, the preacher repeats his utterances of firm faith and thus stirs his inner self into awakening
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse narrates a historical event
